alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 5:38PM EST until January 09 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Cabarrus County in the piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 1000 PM EST. * At 538 PM EST, Excessive runoff will continue across the Rocky River basin into the evening hours. Flooding and high water conditions will linger if not worsen across the Rocky River proper and select tributaries such as Back and Mallard Creeks, as well as Coddle, Irish Buffalo, Coldwater and Dutch Buffalo Creeks. High water conditions across greater Concord and Kannapolis will slowly recede as the evening wears on. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
